questions.text: The 'Banana Boat Song' was this singer's signature song?
questions.explanation:
Harry Belafonte.

	Belafonte's songs helped popularize calypso music.

questions.text: Jack Lemmon won a Best Supporting Actor Oscar for his portrayal of this character?
questions.explanation:
Ensign Pulver.

	The movie was 1955's 'Mister Roberts', and Henry Fonda played the title role.

questions.text: Whose first album was called, 'Everybody Else Is Doing It, So Why Can't We?' ?
questions.explanation:
The Cranberries.

	It was released in 1993 and soon after that, the Irish group became a world wide hit.

questions.text: Who directed the film of John Steinbeck's classic, 'The Grapes of Wrath'?
questions.explanation:
John Ford.

	All brilliant directors, but Ford directed that classic, and was best known for his western films.

questions.text: This rock and roller from St. Louis wrote 'Roll Over Beethoven'?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Berry.

	Chuck Berry has had countless artists record his many songs.

questions.text: This monarch was king of England, Scotland and Ireland from 1689 to 1702?
questions.explanation:
William lll (of Orange).

	William lll married Mary, daughter of James ll of England.

questions.text: What Southern-rock band's fourth album released was titled 'Eat a Peach'?
questions.explanation:
The Allman Brothers Band.

	Duane and Greg Allman formed the band in 1968.

questions.text: This New Orleans singer is best known for his song, 'Blueberry Hill'?
questions.explanation:
Fats Domino.

	Born in 1929, Fats Domino also hit it big with, 'I'm Walking' and 'Ain't That a Shame'.

questions.text: This jazz great, born in 1936, hailed from Oklahoma City, and his main instrument was the pocket trumpet?
questions.explanation:
Don Cherry.

	His unique brand of jazz is known world wide, and he can even be heard on albums by Lou Reed and Ian Dury.

questions.text: Born in Los Angeles, in 1962, this baseball player has worn both Met and Yankee uniforms?
questions.explanation:
Darryl Strawberry.

	Darryl's career has had its many ups and downs to say the least. Sorry Phil ... just a joke.
